definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Not only were the Wangs a family of means, but the Wang women were notoriously fertile.
sentences.chinese: 王家不僅富有，而且王氏的女性都子嗣旺盛。

sentences.english: Gusteau had no children, and what of the timing of all this?
sentences.chinese: 古斯特沒有子嗣這件事怎麼會這麼巧？

sentences.english: We are all here the heirs of Plato.
sentences.chinese: 在此我們全是柏拉圖的子嗣。

sentences.english: This rule was invented by the Church to prevent their priests from producing heirs.
sentences.chinese: 這個規則被教堂發明出來，是爲了防止神父們有子嗣。

sentences.english: Whatever befalls the earth befalls the sons of the earth.
sentences.chinese: 任何降臨於大地的災難都將波及她的子嗣。

sentences.english: Children sweeten labours; but they make misfortunes more bitter.
sentences.chinese: 子嗣使勞苦變甜，但是也使不幸更苦。

sentences.english: someone who is addicted to the cruelty of devouring timorous vegetarians, their heirs and assigns.
sentences.chinese: 沉溺於殘酷地吞食那些膽小的素食者及其子嗣的人。

sentences.english: Earth would thus have its first offspring, seeded by spaceship.
sentences.chinese: 地球將首次擁有子嗣，通過宇宙飛船來播撒希望之種。

definition: to give birth to/to give rise to
to adopt/to give for adoption (usually to a childless relative)
to continue/to continue a family line/posterity/heir
wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
